reviews.text: We stayed three nights at the Hisperia Seville and found it comfortable and clean. Check in was smooth and the staff were helpful. It is located about a minute walk from the Nervion metro station. The shopping street Luis de Morales is round the corner and is two minutes walk away. Coming from the airport, bus EA stops on Luis de Morales just opposite El Corte Ingles. To catch the bus back to the airport, the bus stop located in front of the Nervion Gallery/Novotel is five minutes walk away.
reviews.title: Good value hotel near the shopping area.

reviews.text: However, that said, it is about a twenty minute walk to the barrios of Santa Cruz in the old part of the city. From there, it is a town minute walk to the cathedral. There are lots to see among the warren of narrow streets and there are many watering holes to stop and rest aching feet and to savour the wine and tapas. Bar Alfalfa was worth a visit at lunch even though always crowded. Bodguita Casablanca in a side street just round the corner from the cathedral served good traditional tapas for lunch. It was impossible to get seating and I think tapas is best eaten standing at a small table.
reviews.title: A very good hotel

reviews.text: For dinner, we went to Vineria San Telmo where tapas was served with a modern twist. We also visited El 3 de Oro for dinner on the first night in Seville.
reviews.title: great value! I recommend

reviews.text: No, this hotel is not in the tourist area of old Sevilla, but sometimes that is an advantage (crowded restaurants, higher prices, getting away from other tourists!). The location is right next to the Nervion Subway Station (2 stops from Old Sevilla) and a 15-20 minute drive from the airport.
reviews.title: Out of old town, good transport location

reviews.text: This is not a modern glass and steel hotel. And It has many of the charms of a privately owned, boutique hotel but without the exorbitant price.
reviews.title: If you do not compare with other **** hotels

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I went to Seville Bridge All Saints, and the penalty was we were only one night, because the hotel very nice. Staff charming, attentive and profesionales.The room was charming and wide, six feet bed, mini bar and a big bathroom.Excellent cleaning.Relatively near to the town centre, with many shops around. P.S. I do not understand how there can be so many people who pull this fault this hotel and other Hotels of the NH group.Perhaps is that my family and I are very lucky when we travel.
reviews.title: A good hotel to stay in Seville

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is located not just close to the main historical sites. But the metro station is in 50 meters from the hotel. This is very convenient. The center might be reached by metro in 5 min. The Central Raiway station could be reached by taxi in 5 min. Breakfast was very good. The staff was helpful.
reviews.title: good hotel, but the rooms might be better

reviews.text: The hotel must be build 40 years ago. The rooms were a disappointment. A bit shabby and dark. Though everything worked well in the room.
reviews.title: Four-star hotel without a heater?

reviews.text: We book the rooms 3 weeks before the trip and it was good value for money.
reviews.title: Great hotel in many ways

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is good but be ready to take a 10-15-minute walk to the city center. I was really happy that they allowed me to do an early check-in. The rooms were nice and clean. However, I had problems with the heater. I called the attention of the morning receptionist and told her that the heater of the living room and bathroom were not working well. She told me that it was because the room service staff had not finished cleaing yet so the heater was not fully operating that time. I found out from the evening receptionist that the room given to me really had problems with the heater. Someone was lying? I don't know. Good that she offered me another room. By the way, that was the third time I called their attention about the heater.
reviews.title: Good base for sightseeing.

reviews.text: The Hesperia is ideally placed for everything, the old city, shopping and close to the main roads in and out of Seville. The rooms are really big and spacious and breakfast was really good, value for money it is one f the best hotels I have stayed in for a major city. Would definitely use this hotel again.
reviews.title: Really good location and great value

reviews.text: This hotel is good value for money. Nice comfortable clean rooms and good amenities. The lobby looks like that of a 5 star hotel and the breakfast was good. Just beware of taxi drivers trying to scam tourists by charging them US $30 to the bus station when the trip cost only US $6. This was the only bad experience of this city.
reviews.title: Good location

reviews.text: Internet access is a funny thing... If you are a tourist wanting to sent mails and go on Facebook to rave about Sevilla and its Tapas bars, beer and how it is so cheap... internet will be "Great" as many mention in these reviews.
reviews.title: No internet access...

reviews.text: If you are on a business trip and need to work (email, download, send pictures etc) you are in for a surprise. Internet here is basically non existent on the floors, especially at peak hours when tourists are back and all on Facebook. When you mention this to the receptionist, it seems that all this is very normal!
reviews.title: Clean, comfortable and roomy!

reviews.text: Hesperia needs to wake up and smell the coffee! How about adding an exclusive antenna for those who wish to pay for premium access? How can you not think about something so logical and so common in other hotels?
reviews.title: Old hotel but nice rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very good hotel. We stayed here for two nights and i can recommend this hotel. Just 10 min walk to the old city. Clean rooms. spacious bathroom and comfortable beds.
reviews.title: excellent hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We originally had a reservation in a different hotel but due to a problem with the reservation we where moved to Hesperia. A really nice hotel, friendly staff and very clean. The friendly receptionist, seeing it was my birthday, upgraded our room to the junior suite :)
reviews.title: Very nice

reviews.text: The only set back was when we tried to order from room service and found that no body spoke English, so we tried to read what we wanted from the Spanish menu and still we received totally different dishes then what we wanted.
reviews.title: Average Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all really enjoyed our stay and would definitely recommend it.
reviews.title: well situated but a bit old

reviews.text: The hotel doesn't deserve a 4 star rating - maybe 3.5. Everything was just OK nothing to rave about - a little bit far from the toursit places unless you enjoy a long walk. It has a gym and great indoor swimming pool for those that like doing laps BUT it is independently operated and costs Euro14 each visit - I actually don't mind this and wish more hotels would do it as it provides excellent facilities - although I didn't use the gym itself the equipment was new and modern.
reviews.title: Amazing Hotel! Fantastic Location!
